p.s: Teacher: How would you say, "The car is fast"?
Student: Das Auto ist schnell.
Teacher: Great job! To say, "faster", simply say "schneller", just like English
Teacher: Just add er to "schnell" and we get "schneller"
Teacher: And "faster than", becomes, "schneller als"
Teacher: So how would you say, "The car is faster than the bicycle"?
Student: Das Auto, ist schneller, als das Fahrrad.
Teacher: Right! Das Auto, ist schneller, als das Fahrrad
Teacher: To say "fastest", we must say, schnellsten
Just add sten to "schnell"
Teacher: So how would you say, "The car is the fastest"?
Student: Das Auto, ist, am schnellsten.
Teacher: Correct! Das Auto, ist, am schnellsten
Teacher: Now try saying, "The dog is friendly."
Student: Der Hund ist freundlich.
Teacher: Excellent! How about, "The dog is friendlier than the cat"?
Student: Der Hund ist freundlicher als die Katze.
Teacher: And for, "The dog is the friendliest"?
Student: Der Hund ist am freundlichsten.
Teacher: Nice!
Teacher: How would you say, "The restaurant is delicious"?
Student: Das Restaurant ist lecker.
Teacher: Well done! Now, compare two restaurants. "The restaurant is more delicious than the cafe."
Teacher: Cafe is "das Cafe"
Student: Das Restaurant ist leckerer als das Café.
Teacher: Fantastic! Lastly, tell me, "The restaurant is the most delicious."
Student: Das Restaurant ist am leckersten.
Teacher: Bravo!
Teacher: How would you say, "The city is beautiful"?
Student: Die Stadt ist schön.
Teacher: Well done! Now, compare two cities. "Munich is more beautiful than Berlin."
Student: München ist schöner als Berlin.
Teacher: Fantastic! Lastly, tell me, "Munich is the most beautiful."
Student: München ist am schönsten.
Teacher: Bravo!
